description: ADVERTISEMENT CONSENT FOR THE DISPLAY OF 2 x INTERNALLY ILLUMINATED FASCIA SIGNS
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - This consent shall expire 5 years from the date of this decision.
Condition : 2 - No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

Condition : 3 - No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to endanger persons using any highway, railway, waterway, dock, harbour or aerodrome (civil or military), obscure or hinder the ready interpretation of any traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air, or hinder the operation of any device used for the purpose of security or surveillance or for measuring the speed of any vehicle.
Condition : 4 - Any advertisement displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not impair the visual amenity of the site.
Condition : 5 - Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not endanger the public.

Condition : 6 - The intensity of the illumination shall accord with the Institute of Lighting Engineers Professional Lighting Guide 05, 'The Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements (2014)' , and shall not exceed 600cd/m2 during the hours of darkness.

Reason:  In the interest of Highway safety and to comply with policy DM D5 of the Sites & Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 7 - There should be no special effects (including noise, smell, smoke, animation, exposed cold cathode tubing, flashing, scrolling, three dimensional, intermittent or video elements) of any kind.

Reason:  In the interest of Highway safety and to comply with policy DM D5 of the Sites & Policies Plan 2014
Condition : 8 - All vehicles associated with the installation of the signage must only park/ stop at permitted locations and within the time periods permitted by existing on street restrictions.
Condition : 9 - No skips or construction materials shall be kept on the footway or carriageway of the TLRN at any point.

Condition : 10 - The footway and carriageway of the A24 High Street Colliers Wood must not be blocked during works to install of the signage. Temporary obstructions during the installation works must be kept to a minimum and should not encroach on the clear space needed to provide safe passage to pedestrians or obstruct the flow of traffic on the A24 High Street Colliers Wood.

Condition : 11 - Should the applicant wish to install scaffolding on the footway of A24 High Street Colliers Wood whilst undertaking works to install the signage, this will be subject to a separate Section 169 licence application under the Highways Act 1980 to the Asset Operations Team at TfL. For more information please go to https://www.tfl.gov.uk/info-for/urban-planning-and-construction/highway-licences.
